sub_topic: Predicting the molecular geometry of a molecule
message_1: What is the molecular geometry of a water molecule (H2O)?
message_2: The molecular geometry of a water molecule (H2O) is bent or V-shaped. This is due to the presence of two lone pairs of electrons on the oxygen atom, which repel the two hydrogen atoms, causing the H-O-H bond angle to be approximately 104.5 degrees.
